Machine readable finding aid created by Susan Kriete.New-York Historical SocietyNew-York Historical Society170 Central Park WestNew York, NY 10024(212) 873-3400This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace 2022-04-28T00:40:03 The documents in the collection are in English.
New-York Historical Society
June Rovenger Photograph Collection
Rovenger, June, 1933-2012
PR 291
0.54 Linear feet (2 boxes)
circa 1970's, 2000's This collection consists of photographs of Harlem, Greenwich Village, and street fairs and other events in New York City. Materials in this collection may be stored offsite. For more information on making arrangements to consult them, please visit www.nyhistory.org/library/visit.
Biographical note
June Rovenger (1933-2012) was a New York City theater director. She directed a number of off-Broadway productions from the 1960's to the 1990's, including Shakespeare's Richard III, Eugene O'Neil's Beyond the Horizon, andThe Rivals by Richard Brinsley Sheridan.
Rovenger was also an amateur photographer, and in her later years took photography classes at the International Center for Photography (where Amy Arbus was one of her instructors) and the Education Alliance. From the 1960's until her death, she lived in a rent-controlled apartment on Commerce Street; her tiny bathroom could be converted into a darkroom where she developed her own prints. She photographed many actors and performers, as well as street scenes in Harlem and her own West Village neighborhood.
Scope and Contents
The June Rovenger Photograph Collection consists of approximately 300 black and white photographic prints, along with a few color photos, contact sheets and negatives. The photographs include portraits and street scenes in Harlem in the 1970's; street fairs, snow scenes and protests in the West Village in the 2000's; and portraits of children. A few of the contact sheets are marked with comments, presumably from one of Rovenger's photograph class instructors.
Preferred Citation
This collection should be cited as: June Rovenger Photograph Collection, PR 291, Department of Prints, Photographs, and Architectural Collections, The New-York Historical Society.
Provenance
Gift of Micaela Walker, 2012
Use restrictions
Taking images of documents from the library collections for reference purposes by using hand-held cameras and in accordance with the library's photography guidelines is encouraged. As an alternative, patrons may request up to 20 images per day from staff.
Application to use images from this collection for publication should be made in writing to: Department of Rights and Reproductions, The New-York Historical Society, 170 Central Park West, New York, NY 10024-5194, rightsandrepro@nyhistory.org. Phone: (212) 873-3400 ext. 282.
Copyrights and other proprietary rights may subsist in individuals and entities other than the New-York Historical Society, in which case the patron is responsible for securing permission from those parties. For fuller information about rights and reproductions from N-YHS visit: https://www.nyhistory.org/about/rights-reproductions
Access restrictions
Materials in this collection may be stored offsite. For more information on making arrangements to consult them, please visit www.nyhistory.org/library/visit.
Arrangement
This collection has been organized into the following two series:
Series I: Photographic prints (8 x 10 inches and smaller), contact sheets and negatives
Series II: Photographic prints (11 x 13 inches)
Harlem (New York, N.Y.) Parades -- New York (State) -- New York. Greenwich Village (New York, N.Y.) -- Pictorial works.
